channel.title: CVE Feed for openEuler -- iSulad
channel.description: The latest CVEs for openEuler -- iSulad

item.title: CVE-2021-33636|2024-09-09T14:15:38.166Z -- openeuler -- isulad
item.description: When the isula load command is used to load malicious images, attackers can execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2021-33638|2024-09-09T14:09:44.635Z -- openeuler -- isulad
item.description: When the isula cp command is used to copy files from a container to a host machine and the container is controlled by an attacker, the attacker can escape the container.

item.title: CVE-2021-33635|2024-09-09T14:20:16.034Z -- openeuler -- isulad
item.description: When malicious images are pulled by isula pull, attackers can execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2021-33637|2024-09-09T14:10:35.837Z -- openeuler -- isulad
item.description: When the isula export command is used to export a container to an image and the container is controlled by an attacker, the attacker can escape the container.

item.title: CVE-2021-33632|2024-08-01T19:19:38.237Z -- openeuler -- isulad
item.description:
Time-of-check Time-of-use (TOCTOU) Race Condition vulnerability in openEuler iSulad on Linux allows Leveraging Time-of-Check and Time-of-Use (TOCTOU) Race Conditions. This vulnerability is associated with program files https://gitee.Com/openeuler/iSulad/blob/master/src/cmd/isulad/main.C.
This issue affects iSulad: 2.0.18-13, from 2.1.4-1 through 2.1.4-2.
